data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle
data.output: As a vehicle owner and driver for over 40 years, I have been very fortunate to have owned a variety of different vehicles. I have not owned an electric vehicle, much to its early development and cost to purchase. I like the idea of helping the environment and utilising clean energy, but I'm afraid it is beyond my price point at this time. I therefore have only owned petrol or diesel cars which require the use of a pump to fill a tank rather than top up a battery.

data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it
data.output: The skill of written communication is dying. Having worked away from home for extended periods of time from loved ones, I would eagerly anticipate the arrival of a letter to pick up my morale. Now we write emails sent electronically, but I used to love a trip to the post box to send my communication instead. Email is easier and prevents the need to purchase a rather expensive stamp to deliver them these days. Electronic emails are instantly sent and received rather than have to specifically take a trip out to send a letter by post.

data.boring_theme: having an organ empire and complying with regulations
data.output: My friend Archie is gravely ill and needs a new organ as hHis Kidney is failing rapidly and in need of a transplant. The NHS empire, our National Health Service says I am a matching donor, I have a problem in as much as I love my friend very much, but I am not 100% sure I want to comply and go ahead with giving up one of my kidneys, even for my dear friend. I am worried about my future health needs.

data.boring_theme: the feeling of gloom you have about an existing payment
data.output: What a fantastic day to exist. The sun is shining in the bright blue sky which is such a lovely change to the gloom-laden skies of late. Grey, rainy days have now been usurped with the payment of such glorious weather for once this awful summer.
